question_sentence: Which city was rocked this week by a major bridge collapse?
evidence: Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge collapsed after a container ship lost power early Tuesday and crashed into it, sending people and vehicles into the frigid Patapsco River.

question_sentence: The Supreme Court will soon decide the future of which medication?
evidence: The fate of the abortion pill lies with the Supreme Court. The justices are being asked whether the FDA overstepped its authority by making it easier to obtain mifepristone, one of two drugs used in medication abortion.

question_sentence: Millions of people around the world celebrated Holi this week, also known as the festival of colors. Where are the celebrations most popular?
evidence: Holi, a vibrant Hindu festival, is celebrated by millions of people around the world — with many large-scale gatherings taking place across India.

question_sentence: Which airline may have to put some of its expansion plans on hold after a string of recent flight mishaps?
evidence: After nearly a dozen incidents on flights this month, United Airlines may be temporarily prevented from adding new routes as the FAA is increasing oversight of the troubled airline.

question_sentence: Ireland's new prime minister recently became the youngest leader in the country's history. How old is he?
evidence: Ireland’s governing party named 37-year-old Simon Harris as its new leader.

question_sentence: After more than 140 years under construction, which famous landmark is expected to be completed in 2026?
evidence: The famous Sagrada Familia in Barcelona is set to become the world's tallest church once construction is completed in 2026.

question_sentence: Which state passed a new law banning children under the age of 14 from having their own social media accounts?
evidence: Florida Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis signed a law Monday restricting social media access for children.

question_sentence: Which iconic movie prop recently sold at auction for more than $700,000?
choices: Ruby Slippers from "The Wizard of Oz"
DeLorean sports car from "Back to the Future"
evidence: One of the most hotly-debated props in cinematic history — the floating wood panel from James Cameron's 1997 movie "Titanic" — recently sold at auction for more than $700,000.

question_sentence: Who did independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. name as his running mate?
choices: Attorney and tech entrepreneur Nicole Shanahan
evidence: Kennedy announced attorney and entrepreneur Nicole Shanahan will serve as his running mate in the 2024 presidential race. Kennedy's candidacy has raised alarm bells among some Democrats, who see him as a spoiler candidate who could help Donald Trump defeat President Joe Biden in November.

question_sentence: Which food item will soon be added to McDonald's menus?
evidence: Krispy Kreme doughnuts are coming to McDonald's. The two companies are collaborating to offer their customers a new doughnut-coffee pairing.

question_sentence: Which Delaware sandwich shop’s sandwich will be served at Citizens Bank Park during the 2024 baseball season?
Which of Edgar Allan Poe’s famous tales inspired the cocktail called “Cocktail of Red Death” featured in the speakeasy?
choices: The Fall of the House of Usher
The Masque of the Red Death

choices: Voters approved the funding request for district expansions.
